etymology.description: semantic: 钅(金) (jīn, 'metal') + phonetic: 呙(呙) (guō, 'pot') = metal pot
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 钅(金) (jīn, 'metal') to indicate the material of the object and 呙(呙) (guō, 'pot') as the phonetic element, reflecting the character's association with metal containers.
etymology.simplification: 鍋(鍋)→锅(鍋): 钅(金) (jīn, 'metal') replaced 金(金) for a simpler form while retaining the semantic element.

examples.chinese: 我买了一个新锅(我買了一個新鍋)。
妈妈用锅(媽媽用鍋)，煮了一锅汤(煮了一鍋湯)。
examples.pinyin: Māma yòng guō, zhǔle yī guō tāng.
examples.english: Mom used a pot to cook some soup.

examples.chinese: 在厨房角落里(在廚房角落裡)，那口锅闪着光(那口鍋閃著光)。
examples.pinyin: Zài chúfáng jiǎoluò lǐ, nà kǒu guō shǎn zhe guāng.
examples.english: In the corner of the kitchen, that pot sparkles.
